service:
AWS Service Catalog

Overview

AWS Service Catalog allows organizations to create and manage catalogs of IT services that are approved for use on AWS. This documentation provides reference material for the AWS Service Catalog end user API. To get the most out of this documentation, you need to be familiar with the terminology discussed in AWS Service Catalog Concepts.

Additional Resources

  • AWS Service Catalog Administrator Guide

  • AWS Service Catalog User Guide

operations.DescribeProduct:
Retrieves information about a specified product.

This operation is functionally identical to DescribeProductView except that it takes as input ProductId instead of ProductViewId.
operations.DescribeProductView:
Retrieves information about a specified product.

This operation is functionally identical to DescribeProduct except that it takes as input ProductViewId instead of ProductId.
operations.DescribeProvisioningParameters: Provides information about parameters required to provision a specified product in a specified manner. Use this operation to obtain the list of ProvisioningArtifactParameters parameters available to call the ProvisionProduct operation for the specified product.
operations.DescribeRecord: Retrieves a paginated list of the full details of a specific request. Use this operation after calling a request operation (ProvisionProduct, TerminateProvisionedProduct, or UpdateProvisionedProduct).
operations.ListLaunchPaths: Returns a paginated list of all paths to a specified product. A path is how the user has access to a specified product, and is necessary when provisioning a product. A path also determines the constraints put on the product.
operations.ListRecordHistory: Returns a paginated list of all performed requests, in the form of RecordDetails objects that are filtered as specified.
operations.ProvisionProduct:
Requests a Provision of a specified product. A ProvisionedProduct is a resourced instance for a product. For example, provisioning a CloudFormation-template-backed product results in launching a CloudFormation stack and all the underlying resources that come with it.

You can check the status of this request using the DescribeRecord operation.
operations.ScanProvisionedProducts: Returns a paginated list of all the ProvisionedProduct objects that are currently available (not terminated).
operations.SearchProducts:
Returns a paginated list all of the Products objects to which the caller has access.

The output of this operation can be used as input for other operations, such as DescribeProductView.
operations.TerminateProvisionedProduct:
Requests termination of an existing ProvisionedProduct object. If there are Tags associated with the object, they are terminated when the ProvisionedProduct object is terminated.

This operation does not delete any records associated with the ProvisionedProduct object.

You can check the status of this request using the DescribeRecord operation.
operations.UpdateProvisionedProduct:
Requests updates to the configuration of an existing ProvisionedProduct object. If there are tags associated with the object, they cannot be updated or added with this operation. Depending on the specific updates requested, this operation may update with no interruption, with some interruption, or replace the ProvisionedProduct object entirely.

You can check the status of this request using the DescribeRecord operation.

refs.DescribeProductInput$AcceptLanguage:
The language code to use for this operation. Supported language codes are as follows:

"en" (English)

"jp" (Japanese)

"zh" (Chinese)

If no code is specified, "en" is used as the default.

refs.ListRecordHistoryInput$AccessLevelFilter: The access level for obtaining results. If left unspecified, User level access is used.
refs.ScanProvisionedProductsInput$AccessLevel: The access level for obtaining results. If left unspecified, User level access is used.

refs.AccessLevelFilter$Key:
Specifies the access level.

Account allows results at the account level.

Role allows results based on the federated role of the specified user.

User allows results limited to the specified user.

refs.AccessLevelFilter$Value: Specifies the user to which the access level applies. A value of Self is currently supported.

refs.ParameterConstraints$AllowedValues: The values that the administrator has allowed for the parameter.

refs.ProductViewAggregationValue$ApproximateC: An approximate count of the products that match the value.

refs.ProductViewAggregationValue$Value: The value of the product view aggregation.

refs.DescribeProvisioningParametersOutput$Con: The list of constraint summaries that apply to provisioning this product.
refs.LaunchPathSummary$ConstraintSummaries: List of constraints on the portfolio-product relationship.

ConstraintSummary.base: An administrator-specified constraint to apply when provisioning a product.

refs.RecordDetail$CreatedTime: The time when the record for the ProvisionedProduct object was created.

refs.ProductViewSummary$HasDefaultPath: A value of false indicates that the product does not have a default path, while a value of true indicates that it does. If it's false, call ListLaunchPaths to disambiguate between paths. If true, ListLaunchPaths is not required, and the output of the ProductViewSummary operation can be used directly with DescribeProvisioningParameters.

refs.DescribeProvisioningParametersInput$Prov: The provisioning artifact identifier for this product.
refs.DescribeProvisioningParametersInput$Path: The identifier of the path for this product's provisioning. This value is optional if the product has a default path, and is required if there is more than one path for the specified product.
refs.DescribeRecordInput$Id: The record identifier of the ProvisionedProduct object for which to retrieve output information. This is the RecordDetail.RecordId obtained from the request operation's response.
refs.LaunchPathSummary$Id: The unique identifier of the product path.
refs.ListLaunchPathsInput$ProductId: Identifies the product for which to retrieve LaunchPathSummaries information.
refs.ProvisionProductInput$ProvisioningArtifa: The provisioning artifact identifier for this product.
refs.ProvisionProductInput$PathId: The identifier of the path for this product's provisioning. This value is optional if the product has a default path, and is required if there is more than one path for the specified product.
refs.RecordDetail$RecordId: The identifier of the ProvisionedProduct object record.
refs.RecordDetail$ProvisioningArtifactId: The provisioning artifact identifier for this product.
refs.RecordDetail$PathId: The identifier of the path for this product's provisioning.
refs.TerminateProvisionedProductInput$Provisi: The identifier of the ProvisionedProduct object to terminate. You must specify either ProvisionedProductName or ProvisionedProductId, but not both.
refs.UpdateProvisionedProductInput$Provisione: The identifier of the ProvisionedProduct object to update. You must specify either ProvisionedProductName or ProvisionedProductId, but not both.
refs.UpdateProvisionedProductInput$Provisioni: The provisioning artifact identifier for this product.
refs.UpdateProvisionedProductInput$PathId: The identifier of the path to use in the updated ProvisionedProduct object. This value is optional if the product has a default path, and is required if there is more than one path for the specified product.

refs.ProvisionProductInput$ProvisionToken: An idempotency token that uniquely identifies the provisioning request.
refs.ProvisionedProductDetail$IdempotencyToke: An idempotency token that uniquely identifies this ProvisionedProduct.
refs.TerminateProvisionedProductInput$Termina: An idempotency token that uniquely identifies the termination request. This token is only valid during the termination process. After the ProvisionedProduct object is terminated, further requests to terminate the same ProvisionedProduct object always return ResourceNotFound regardless of the value of TerminateToken.
refs.UpdateProvisionedProductInput$UpdateToke: The idempotency token that uniquely identifies the provisioning update request.

refs.TerminateProvisionedProductInput$IgnoreE: If set to true, AWS Service Catalog stops managing the specified ProvisionedProduct object even if it cannot delete the underlying resources.

refs.UsageInstruction$Type: The usage instruction type for the value.

refs.UsageInstruction$Value: The usage instruction value for this type.

InvalidParametersException.base: One or more parameters provided to the operation are invalid.

refs.ProvisionedProductDetail$LastRecordId: The record identifier of the last request performed on this ProvisionedProduct object.

refs.ListLaunchPathsOutput$LaunchPathSummarie: List of launch path information summaries for the specified PageToken.

LaunchPathSummary.base: Summary information about a path for a user to have access to a specified product.

ListRecordHistorySearchFilter.base: The search filter to limit results when listing request history records.

refs.ProvisioningArtifactParameter$IsNoEcho: If this value is true, the value for this parameter is obfuscated from view when the parameter is retrieved. This parameter is used to hide sensitive information.

refs.ProvisionProductInput$NotificationArns: Passed to CloudFormation. The SNS topic ARNs to which to publish stack-related events.

refs.DescribeRecordInput$PageSize: The maximum number of items to return in the results. If more results exist than fit in the specified PageSize, the value of NextPageToken in the response is non-null.
refs.ListLaunchPathsInput$PageSize: The maximum number of items to return in the results. If more results exist than fit in the specified PageSize, the value of NextPageToken in the response is non-null.
refs.ListRecordHistoryInput$PageSize: The maximum number of items to return in the results. If more results exist than fit in the specified PageSize, the value of NextPageToken in the response is non-null.
refs.ScanProvisionedProductsInput$PageSize: The maximum number of items to return in the results. If more results exist than fit in the specified PageSize, the value of NextPageToken in the response is non-null.
refs.SearchProductsInput$PageSize: The maximum number of items to return in the results. If more results exist than fit in the specified PageSize, the value of NextPageToken in the response is non-null.

refs.DescribeRecordInput$PageToken: The page token of the first page retrieved. If null, this retrieves the first page of size PageSize.
refs.DescribeRecordOutput$NextPageToken: The page token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.
refs.ListLaunchPathsInput$PageToken: The page token of the first page retrieved. If null, this retrieves the first page of size PageSize.
refs.ListLaunchPathsOutput$NextPageToken: The page token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.
refs.ListRecordHistoryInput$PageToken: The page token of the first page retrieved. If null, this retrieves the first page of size PageSize.
refs.ListRecordHistoryOutput$NextPageToken: The page token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.
refs.ScanProvisionedProductsInput$PageToken: The page token of the first page retrieved. If null, this retrieves the first page of size PageSize.
refs.ScanProvisionedProductsOutput$NextPageTo: The page token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.
refs.SearchProductsInput$PageToken: The page token of the first page retrieved. If null, this retrieves the first page of size PageSize.
refs.SearchProductsOutput$NextPageToken: The page token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

ParameterConstraints.base: The constraints that the administrator has put on the parameter.

refs.ProvisioningArtifactParameter$ParameterC: The list of constraints that the administrator has put on the parameter.

refs.ProvisioningParameter$Value: The value to use for provisioning. Any constraints on this value can be found in ProvisioningArtifactParameter for Key.
refs.UpdateProvisioningParameter$Value: The value to use for updating the product provisioning. Any constraints on this value can be found in the ProvisioningArtifactParameter parameter for Key.

refs.LaunchPathSummary$Name: Corresponds to the name of the portfolio to which the user was assigned.

refs.ProductViewSummary$Type: The product type. Contact the product administrator for the significance of this value.

ProductViewAggregationValue.base: A single product view aggregation value/count pair, containing metadata about each product to which the calling user has access.

refs.SearchProductsOutput$ProductViewAggregat: A list of the product view aggregation value objects.

refs.ProductViewSummary$Distributor: The distributor of the product. Contact the product administrator for the significance of this value.

refs.SearchProductsInput$Filters: The list of filters with which to limit search results. If no search filters are specified, the output is all the products to which the calling user has access.

refs.ProductViewSummary$Owner: The owner of the product. Contact the product administrator for the significance of this value.

refs.SearchProductsInput$SortBy: The sort field specifier. If no value is specified, results are not sorted.

refs.SearchProductsOutput$ProductViewSummarie: A list of the product view summary objects.

ProductViewSummary.base: The summary metadata about the specified product.

refs.DescribeProductOutput$ProductViewSummary: The summary metadata about the specified product.
refs.DescribeProductViewOutput$ProductViewSum: The summary metadata about the specified product.

refs.ProvisionProductInput$ProvisionedProduct: A user-friendly name to identify the ProvisionedProduct object. This value must be unique for the AWS account and cannot be updated after the product is provisioned.
refs.RecordDetail$ProvisionedProductName: The user-friendly name of the ProvisionedProduct object.

refs.ProvisionedProductDetail$Name: The user-friendly name of the ProvisionedProduct object.
refs.ProvisionedProductDetail$Arn: The ARN associated with the ProvisionedProduct object.
refs.TerminateProvisionedProductInput$Provisi: The name of the ProvisionedProduct object to terminate. You must specify either ProvisionedProductName or ProvisionedProductId, but not both.
refs.UpdateProvisionedProductInput$Provisione: The updated name of the ProvisionedProduct object . You must specify either ProvisionedProductName or ProvisionedProductId, but not both.

refs.ProvisionedProductDetail$StatusMessage: The current status message of the ProvisionedProduct.

ProvisioningArtifact.base: Contains information indicating the ways in which a product can be provisioned.

refs.ProvisioningArtifact$CreatedTime: The time that the artifact was created by the Administrator.

ProvisioningArtifactParameter.base: A parameter used to successfully provision the product. This value includes a list of allowable values and additional metadata.

refs.DescribeProvisioningParametersOutput$Pro: The list of parameters used to successfully provision the product. Each parameter includes a list of allowable values and additional metadata about each parameter.

refs.DescribeProductOutput$ProvisioningArtifa: A list of provisioning artifact objects for the specified product. The ProvisioningArtifacts parameter represent the ways the specified product can be provisioned.
refs.DescribeProductViewOutput$ProvisioningAr: A list of provisioning artifact objects for the specified product. The ProvisioningArtifacts represent the ways in which the specified product can be provisioned.

ProvisioningParameter.base: The arameter key/value pairs used to provision a product.

refs.ProvisionProductInput$ProvisioningParame: Parameters specified by the administrator that are required for provisioning the product.

RecordDetail.base: The full details of a specific ProvisionedProduct object.

refs.DescribeRecordOutput$RecordDetail: Detailed record information for the specified product.
refs.ProvisionProductOutput$RecordDetail: The detailed result of the ProvisionProduct request, containing the inputs made to that request, the current state of the request, a pointer to the ProvisionedProduct object of the request, and a list of any errors that the request encountered.
refs.TerminateProvisionedProductOutput$Record: The detailed result of the TerminateProvisionedProduct request, containing the inputs made to that request, the current state of the request, a pointer to the ProvisionedProduct object that the request is modifying, and a list of any errors that the request encountered.
refs.UpdateProvisionedProductOutput$RecordDet: The detailed result of the UpdateProvisionedProduct request, containing the inputs made to that request, the current state of the request, a pointer to the ProvisionedProduct object that the request is modifying, and a list of any errors that the request encountered.

refs.ListRecordHistoryOutput$RecordDetails: A list of record detail objects, listed in reverse chronological order.

RecordError.base: The error code and description resulting from an operation.

refs.RecordDetail$RecordErrors: A list of errors that occurred while processing the request.

RecordOutput.base: An output for the specified Product object created as the result of a request. For example, a CloudFormation-backed product that creates an S3 bucket would have an output for the S3 bucket URL.

refs.DescribeRecordOutput$RecordOutputs: A list of outputs for the specified Product object created as the result of a request. For example, a CloudFormation-backed product that creates an S3 bucket would have an output for the S3 bucket URL.

RecordTag.base: A tag associated with the record, stored as a key-value pair.

refs.RecordDetail$RecordTags: List of tags associated with this record.

refs.SearchProductsInput$SortOrder: The sort order specifier. If no value is specified, results are not sorted.

refs.ProductViewSummary$SupportDescription: The description of the support for this Product.

refs.ProductViewSummary$SupportEmail: The email contact information to obtain support for this Product.

refs.ProductViewSummary$SupportUrl: The URL information to obtain support for this Product.

Tag.base: Key/value pairs to associate with this provisioning. These tags are entirely discretionary and are propagated to the resources created in the provisioning.

refs.LaunchPathSummary$Tags: List of tags used by this launch path.
refs.ProvisionProductInput$Tags: A list of tags to use as provisioning options.

UpdateProvisioningParameter.base: The parameter key/value pair used to update a ProvisionedProduct object. If UsePreviousValue is set to true, Value is ignored and the value for Key is kept as previously set (current value).

refs.UpdateProvisionedProductInput$Provisioni: A list of ProvisioningParameter objects used to update the ProvisionedProduct object.

refs.RecordDetail$UpdatedTime: The time when the record for the ProvisionedProduct object was last updated.

refs.DescribeProvisioningParametersOutput$Usa: Any additional metadata specifically related to the provisioning of the product. For example, see the Version field of the CloudFormation template.

refs.UpdateProvisioningParameter$UsePreviousV: If true, uses the currently set value for Key, ignoring UpdateProvisioningParameter.Value.
